intro: Thelymitra kangaloonica, commonly known as the Kangaloon spider-orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a single, slender spike that bears several small, pale green to yellowish flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring and is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils. Thelymitra kangaloonica is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in its native habitat. It is also listed as vulnerable due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
